intro: Koeiea afghanica, commonly known as the Afghan koeiea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its fragrant, compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the summer months. Koeiea afghanica is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
